titleStmt.title: To the three illustrious Sons liuing, of the late All-honourable on earth, but now All-glorious St. in Heauen, Robert, Baron Spencer.

publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

analytic.title: To the three illustrious Sons liuing, of the late All-honourable on earth, but now All-glorious St. in Heauen, Robert, Baron Spencer.

monogr.title: The muses thankfulnesse, or A funerall elegie, consecrated to the perpetuall memory of the late all-honourable, and all-noble lord, Robert, Baron Spencer, of Wormleighton, &c

div.head: To the three illustrious Sons liuing, of the late All-honourable on earth, but now All-glorious St. in Heauen, Robert, Baron Spencer.

lg.l: The due acknowledgements, the Muses sing
Of him, who, though the Fates ordain'd to dye,
Hath left vntainted Honour, free from staine
To his posterity; then great's your gaine,
Faire your enioyments, and your haps are good,
That haue your veynes fil'd with so Noble blood;
So are his vertues in your hearts combin'd,
The rich endowments of his blessed mind;
Be also like him, in this very thing,
Be courteous, to accept this offering.
